content: 1 my shorty socks notes this pattern is written for use of dpns as this is what i use to make my socks i have tried using magic loop flyers and all sorts of other methods but dpns work best for me you should be able to adapt this pattern to work for magic loop my advice would be to run through the pattern in full before starting and making a note of any changes you may need to make the pattern can be worked with contrasting cuff heel and toe like the images but you can also work the whole sock in one colour look out for the useful notes to indicate where you should change colour sizes xs s m l to fit mid-foot circumference about 7 5 / 8 / 8 5 / 9 5 inches 20 / 21 5 / 24 cm stitches 58 60 64 72 needles 2 5mm dpns gauge 8 sts & 12 rounds = 1 inch / 2 5 cm in stocking stitch notions 2 x stitch markers 1 progress keeper to mark beginning of round yarn any sock yarn should work as long as you get the gauge noted grams noted below are approximate amounts for size m i used blue fern yarns hand dyed platinum sock yarn in colours petals on the pavement 25g rose 10g blackberry 10g you may not reprint resell or claim this pattern as your own this is property of blue fern yarns in the countries where you need my permission to make and sell the socks from my pattern i give it freely please feel free to tag me on instagram @bluefernyarns and use the hashtag #myshortysocks useful links and abbreviations are noted at the end of this pattern @ blue fern yarns my shorty socks ©shannon long february 2021 2 from here you will be working in row and not rounds turn your work so the wrong side is facing you pattern note i usually move from working across two needles to one meaning there are cast on and cuff three needles on the work at any one time two for the front of the foot and one cast on 58 60 64 72 using one of the dpns and the long tail cast on method for the heel note if you are wanting a contrast cuff start with your contrast colour set up row ws s1 p27 29 31 35 row 1 rs s1 knit-wise *k1 s1* to last st k1 using needle two *ktbl twice p2* repeat until you have 14 15 16 18 sts on row 2 ws s1 p27 29 31 35 needle two repeat row 1 and 2 for a total of 16 times 32 row in total using needle three *ktbl twice p2* repeat until you have 14 15 16 18 sts on needle three heel turn using needle four *ktbl twice p2* repeat until you have 14 15 16 18 sts on continuing on the one needle
